intro: Tristemma leiocalyx, commonly known as the smooth-leaved tristemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
